ProjectTitle: From Page to Place: Cultural Nation-Building and Authorial Self-Fashioning in the Low Countries (1780-1830)
InitialFeedbackHistory: 14/03/2025 - [REDACTED] storage and backup: [REDACTED] mention that OneDrive is your primary storage solution for research data. [REDACTED] no longer recommend OneDrive for this purpose for a number of reasons, chief among which the fact that, because your OneDrive account is connected to your KU [REDACTED] employment, your data is deleted as soon as you leave the university for any reason. [REDACTED] other words, data stored on OneDrive cannot be accessed by the university itself, which goes against KU [REDACTED] RDM [REDACTED] [REDACTED] find a different storage solution, we recommend you use the ICTS [REDACTED] [REDACTED] (at https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en). - [REDACTED] selection and preservation: [REDACTED] same goes here: for the reasons set out above, OneDrive is not an adequate option for long-term preservation. [REDACTED] simplest solution here is to publish your data on a repository like KU [REDACTED] RDR, which ensures long-term availability of the data. - [REDACTED] and documentation: [REDACTED] you're planning to use [REDACTED] for network analysis, it's best to work with a .csv file (an open format) as opposed to an .xslx file. [REDACTED] formats are also often required when you're sharing data. [REDACTED] try to adhere to a certain metadata standard or at least keep track of the different identifiers you use in the spreadsheet so as to improve reusability of your data.
label: good with suggestions
